page.title: 06KING ALFRED
page.content: There is a statue of King Alfred in the centre of the town, put up in 1911. King Alfred was closely connected with Pewsey. He owned a manor here and also much of the land in and around the village in the ninth century. After one of his successful battles against the Danes he returned to Pewsey where his wife was staying. That was on Holy Cross Day, September 14th. He declared that a feast day in Pewsey forever and it is said to be the origin of Pewsey Carnival still held during this week each year.
